adjective.description: Having a position on the other or further side of something; facing something, especially something of the same type.
examples: a crowd gathered on the opposite side of the street

adjective.description: Diametrically different; of a contrary kind.
examples: a word that is opposite in meaning to another

noun.description: A person or thing that is totally different from or the reverse of someone or something else.
examples: the literal is the opposite of the figurative

adverb.description: In a position facing a specified or implied subject.

preposition.description: In a position on the other side of a specific area from; facing.
(of a leading actor) in a complementary role to (another)
examples: the star was a young man playing opposite an older woman

phrases: clearly, opposites attract, but fortunately, the film doesn't follow typical romantic movie conventions
would such opposites attract, or would these two conflicting musical spirits lock horns and fight it out?
origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin oppositus, past participle of opponere set against.
